text: Carlo Giuliani, O.P. (died 1663) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Ston (1653–1663)."Bishop Carlo Giuliani, O.P." Catholic- Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved August 27, 2016"Diocese of Stagno (Ston)(Sagona)" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved February 29, 2016"Titular Episcopal See of Ston" GCatholic.org. Gabriel Chow. Retrieved February 29, 2016 ==Biography== Carlo Giuliani was ordained a priest in the Order of Preachers. On 3 Feb 1653, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Innocent X as Bishop of Ston. On 9 Feb 1653, he was consecrated bishop by Marcello Santacroce, Bishop of Tivoli, with Giovanni Lucas Moncalvi, Bishop of Guardialfiera, and Riginaldo Lucarini, Bishop of Città della Pieve, serving as co-consecrators. He served as Bishop of Stagno until his death on 3 Nov 1663. == References == Category:17th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Innocent X Category:1663 deaths
title: Carlo Giuliani (bishop)
